t:
You don't know
That someone still remembers you
As a special and unique person
Who touched their life in a way
That no one else could ever do.


                                              cont...
c:
You don't know
That someone still remembers you
As a special and unique person
Who touched their life in a way
That no one else could ever do.

You don't know
That they lost something precious
When they let you go away,
But they can't make the first move
Because they know you won't stay.

You don't know
That you're still in their dreams
As a ghost from the past,
But they have to face reality
And accept that it didn't last.

You don't know
That you're not the only one
Who struggles to forget.
Maybe someone else misses you too
And wishes you had never met.

You don't know
That life has changed without you,
But they still hope for a sign
To reconnect with their old love
And make you theirs again.

You just don't know.



Here's your prompt for the day 219 of Writing Sprints.
